title: Emergency Preparedness Capacity Building Program for Rural Public Health Workforce

context.prior_knowledge: Basic public health concepts and foundational knowledge in biology
context.additional_context: Provides practice-oriented learning environments through digital device-based simulations and case analysis activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain a five-step emergency response procedure during public health crises with 90% accuracy.
Learners successfully perform three consecutive simulations from infectious disease reporting to initial response in a virtual environment.
Learners can prepare an infection control equipment usage manual tailored to rural areas with over 80% accuracy.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
